result.execSummary:
The defendant Fabian J Trinidad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fabian J Trinidad

Defendant Fabian J Trinidad in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Fabian J Trinidad in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF54 & 15CF39
15CF39 - Sentencing Hearing After Revocation 
16CF54 - Plea Hearing

NOTE:  13CF175 - Sentenced and is all ready serving sentence.

Credit for 355 days - 15CF39
Credit for 3 days - 16CF54

State and defense waive PSI.  
Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 in 16CF54 as a repeater.  Court questions, accepts plea and finds guilty.  Court dismisses and reads-in count 2.  
Argument by State.
Argument by Attorney Petros.
Defendant addresses Court.
Court relates and orders:

15CF39 - Count 1 - 3 years 6 months prison - 1 years 6 months initial confinement and 2 years 0 months extended supervision.  Consecutive with 13CF75.  355 days credit.
Dodge Reception Center.
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Any remaining court costs to Judgment.
Same conditions as extended supervision in 13CF75:
Any and all treatment and counseling recommended by probation.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Obtain and maintain employment.
Court costs
DNA surcharge and sample to be taken immediately.


16CF54
SW - 3 years probation.  Consecutive to 13CF175 & 15CF39
Same as extended supervision in other cases:
Any and all treatment and counseling recommended by probation.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Obtain and maintain employment.
Court costs
DNA surcharge and sample to be taken immediately.
No jail credit on this case as consecutive.

Notice of Voter's Rights form given to defendant.

Felony admonitions given.  

Faxed to Jail.

Clerked by AP.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 15CF39 and 16CF54

Defense moves to reschedule.  Court grants motion.
Both above cases rescheduled to 5/23/16 at 3:30 PM
  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Letter to Judge Boyle from Defendant.

Defendant Fabian J Trinidad in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros telephonically.  Defendant Fabian J Trinidad in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions Defendant and accepts waiver.  
Court finds probable cause, accepts waiver and binds over.  
Information filed.  Offense date amended.  Waives reading and enters not guilty plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Faxed to jail.
